title.narrative: OPT 1. 3. QUALITY AND RESILIENT WATER, SANITATION AND HYGIENE SERVICES.

description.narrative: 1.3. National and subnational capacities in selected departments and municipalities are strengthened to develop and monitor integrated and resilient water, sanitation and hygiene services in the four departments receiving UNICEF support.,which contributes to Disaster Risk Reduction, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Sanitation, Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, children between 0 and 5 have access to Integrated Early Childhood Development (IECD) services to guarantee that they survive and thrive, including in emergency situations.

sector.narrative: Sanitation - eliminating open defecation in peri-urban and urban communities
WASH - Enabling environment (policies/strategies, coordination, regulation, financing, planning-monitoring-review, sector capacity development and professionalization)
WASH - risk informed programming including climate resilience disaster and conflict

related-activity.ref: 0510/A0/05/401 OCM 1. EVERY CHILD SURVIVES AND THRIVES

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 1.3. National and subnational capacities in selected departments and municipalities are strengthened to develop and monitor integrated and resilient water, sanitation and hygiene services in the four departments receiving UNICEF support.

description.narrative: Continued UNICEF technical support linked to resilient WASH services helped create a strategy to eliminate open defecation in Bolivia and its prompt implementation. This strategy will improve the health, nutrition and school performance of Bolivian children while contributing to the achievement of Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). UNICEF's work on a replicable and scalable model of sustainable urban decentralized sanitation is also contributing to the realization children's rights and achieving the SDGs. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Number of communities certified free of open defecation through institutional uptake (institutional uptake/indirect)
Number of health care facilities (clinics, health centers, hospitals, etc.) with basic WASH services in the reporting year only, as a result of through institutional uptake (leveraged)

target.value: 2022:7 Health faciliites in El Alto (Senkata) and 21 Health Centers in Independencia

title.narrative: National WASH standards created for health facilities and IECD centers

actual.value: 2018:Elaboration of National Standards for health facilities has been included in 2019 Work Plan with the MoH. No public entity at the national level has the competence on IECD centers, standards in IECD will be elaborated in 2019 in collaboration with El Alto municipality.
